reviewDescription:
Here’s the deal. I think money lion has great potential. But I have to continue to call them out on the whole instacash trickery.

The only way to get it with out a fee is if you wait 3 to 5 business days.

If you choose the turbo option they charge a fee that goes well above the cost of the service. If you barrow the max the let you select at one time $100 they charge an $8.99 fee. If you need say $300 until payday, that $26.97

Then they put on the whole, we don’t charge for this service, please tip us.

If you select 0 the ask you are you sure and have the link saying yes you are next to the highest tip option.

If you accidentally tap that then it’s locked in. There is no way to undo the mistake.

To be clear I take issue with the misleading customers on the scam and not the fee necessarily.

I also take issue with being charged 3 times if I need more.

Let us select the actual amount we need up to the limit set.

Either charge a fee or ask for a tip.

Ironically Money.app might be a template on what right looks like

reviewDescription:
I been a Moneylion customer since 2017. The initial plan was amazing. They invested a dollar everyday you signed into the app. And used it toward your membership fee.
Now the credit builder plus has a glitch. If you want to use it do not set your direct deposit up with the Roar Money account. The senior management said you have to have a external account for the credit builder loan.
So the Roar Money account that Moneylion offers is not good enough for the underwriters to give you the loan.
Direct Deposits take over 2 months to be recognized on your insta cash option also.
The investing portfolio is amazing and the shake and bank rewards do help keep your financial goals growing. I would recommend this as a secondary bank and not a primary since their own account is not good enough for their own credit builder

reviewCompanyResponse: We regret any frustration this has caused, Emarzon! A member of our Advocacy team has reached out to you directly to assist you with this. We look forward t working with you.
reviewDescription:
I want to start by saying this is great app. It’s easy to use and it’s quite engaging. A lot of benefits offered but beware and hopefully my experience can help others here. I downloaded this app due to the early direct deposit they offer. Previously, I had my Bank of America account connected to Moneylion so I can access the instacash feature. Instacash feature is like an advance or like a loan that you would have to pay at the set date. Anyway, I used to get about $600 in instacash limit. Then, suddenly, I noticed that my limit has been decreasing even with the boost coming from other people. Looking at one of their service offer was increased the instacash limit to up to $1000 if you have your direct deposit transferred. Well, that’s what I did and my direct deposit hit today at Moneylion. I paid my previous balance and I’ve been always on time on my payments. I noticed my instacash limit decreased significantly from $600 to $85 like WTH? I contacted customer support and was able to chat with Alexis T. She informed me that the increase in instacash limit is after 2-3 direct deposits. I was like where was that shown in the offer? So, that’s done and I don’t think I can do anything about it. So I inquired about my significant decreased in instacash limit and she informed me that it’s due to Moneylion did not detect any direct deposit in my previously connected bank. No duh, I just moved my direct deposit to Moneylion. I asked why can’t Moneylion detect my newly direct deposit in my Moneylion account and she just told me that it will not detect until 2-3 deposits. Like seriously??? Anyone thinking of transferring here to Moneylion, please be ready and do your preparation. Definitely got screwed this time.

Update: 03/06/2024 it’s been 48 hours since I spoke with a representative like they responded. Still no solution. All they told me that instacash is not detecting my recent direct deposit and that they escalated the problem to an engineer ( God knows who). Been following up daily and no result. Since my query was posted on 02/28/2024, that means I’ve been waiting for a week for a solution. Such a disappointment.
reviewTitle: Increase in instacash limit with direct deposit misleading

reviewDescription: I had a good experience with Moneylion which then turned into a questionable one. Their customer service is excellent and attentive, but I question their security. 2 weeks ago I took an Instacash loan from them and everything went smoothly. You have to give them your bank debit card when you sign up. Well last Friday my bank called me to tell me my debit card number had been compromised. Only two other accounts had it and they may also be culprits, but I'm questioning the security measures of MoneyLion based on the timing of this situation. So I'm not saying don't use them, but just saying be careful with your information. I have closed my account with MoneyLion and made sure they don't have my personal data. I won't use them again.

reviewDescription:
I tried Moneylion. It seemed okay at first, bit to get around usary lending laws, they will loan you up to $100 until your next payday for $7 (often trying to coerce you into tipping also). They claim no interest, but that is equivalent to 7% interest in 2 weeks which is 180% interest per year. If you only need it for 3 days, Still $7 which makes it 800% interest. That is not even the worst.
Apparently they didn't like my spending habits and froze my accounts. I had Roarmoney checking and crypto and they refuse to give my money back. I am just starting the process of filing SEC complaints. This is my first complaint of many.

This is communism with a social credit score. If they don't think you meet the mold of a good globalist, they keep your money.

reviewDescription:
I used to love MoneyLion. But then they hung me out to dry when I needed them most.
I recently experienced a rent hike that I wasn’t going to be able to cover. But then I remembered I had a credit builder loan. There was still a balance due but it was less than the $600 credit reserve set aside for me for when it was paid off and the difference would have perfectly covered the balance I owed for the rent. So i used the reserve to pay off the loan thinking I’d have the rest in my account in a few days.

I was wrong. Some dumb error has kept the reserve from me because it says I have a zero balance but also that I owe $23. It won’t let me pay the $23. But I can’t access My money either. This has been going on for long enough for me to be put out in the rain by the sheriff last night. And MoneyLion customer service despite my desperate pleas over the last few days have done N O T H I N G except tell me the “dedicated team” are on it and that they will update me. They never do. Nothing has changed. And I get the same robotic answer every time i try to talk to them. I just don’t see what would take so long to fix for such a seemingly simple error. They just don’t care at all.
reviewTitle: Don’t care about their customers when they need them

MoneyLion is saying that the payment is valid because it came out after I requested the deferment and the transaction can’t be reversed. They have the deferment date as 07/13/23 which is a complete lie. I never got an an email confirmation about my deferment either, otherwise I would have taken a screenshot of the confirmation when I initially did it. The rep said they would email me with an update but didn’t give me an ETA and after I said I haven’t been getting emails from them. Last email I got from them was on 07/03/2023. I want my $183.02 back.

Then was told I need 3 deposits before it will find my income. You can literally see my direct deposit on their list of transactions from my bank being linked. You can also still see ALL of my direct deposits. I asked for a supervisor and was told that it would take 24-48 hours. They had no problem taking my money but now that I have an issue getting it back I am getting the runaround. I will be canceling them once this is resolved. I was told I have to contact PLAID to get resolution, who is now telling me they cannot help, and only Money Lion can.

reviewDescription: When I signed up with MoneyLion I was asked what days I got paid and how many times per week, which is every Friday. Well a family member sent me some money to help pay for another family member’s baby shower gift and MoneyLion took out my instacash payment from that deposit which was on a Tuesday not a Friday causing me to overdraft my account and incur an overdraft fee from my bank. When I spoke with customer service they said they were sorry and that they take out money when they see a deposit. WTH? Why did you ask me when I get paid in the first place, didn’t I sign a contract stating truthfully when I get paid and when MoneyLion would deduct payments?? This is irresponsible of MoneyLion to just assume a large deposit is a paycheck and blame it on “inconsistent paydays”. Yes they make up rules as they go. Then they lower the amount you can borrow so you can’t even help yourself even though you have paid them back!!! So stupid.

reviewDescription: It hurts my heart to give this company 1 star but I have to bring awareness so other people don’t go through what I’m going through. I been a customer of MoneyLion for years and enjoyed their various products which include instacash (a cool feature to increase your cash flow) and 2 day early direct deposit. The reason for the one star is the dispute process which is very old fashioned and inconvenient to the customer. Imagine a scenario where you didn’t receive your Amazon goods where you spent hundreds or even thousands of hard earned dollars on. You go to the merchant and they can’t help you so you go to the only one you can trust , your card provider aka bank aka MoneyLion. Now you goto dispute and they tell you instead of receiving your provisional credit within hours like most banks do, that you have to wait 10 business days and if “qualified will receive your provisional credit back.” It was a let down hearing that but I waited patiently and the 10th business day comes I contact customer support for them to tell me they working on it and to mail them the dispute. Like what? Why you guys didn’t tell me prior to do that? And now they telling me it can take 90 days to receive it and provisional credits are not guaranteed. All around it sounds like a big red flag and I don’t like that. When people spend their hard earned dollars on something why you guys making the customer feel at fault and holding their money hostage? This is one of the worst experiences ever and I’m moving my direct deposit and will never invest in this business.

reviewCompanyResponse: This is not the type of experience we wish to create, Brian, and we have verified that one of our dedicated customer advocates has reached out to you regarding your situation.
reviewDescription: Still haven’t received my money as of 8/2/23…On July 1st I did a transfer incorrectly. Rather than doing a transfer from my MoneyLion acct to my Navy acct, I did it from my Navy to MoneyLion. That day, my Navy acct couldn’t cover the transfer request. Navy required me pay $29 for insufficient funds but MoneyLion has put a block on my acct since then. They requested pictures of my drivers license, front and back. A copy of my bank statement and a photo. The problem with my bank statement is it says absolutely nothing about a transaction. With MoneyLion because no transfer was made. My statement says payment of $29, insufficient funds. Nothing about MoneyLion because nothing went through. I have called every week and been told “it’s being escalated”. I’ve also been told I need to submit the pictures of license, myself and bank statement 4 times counting today. The total amount is only $750. I contacted the BBB and they are looking into this but I am absolutely spreading the word on MoneyLion. Everyday I tell at least 1 person about this to spread the word. I made the initial mistake but it’s 4 weeks later. Oh yeah, I also took a screenshot of the incorrect transfer request. I sent this to them as well as additional proof of who I am. Since it’s time stamped and shows a date it further backs my identity and explains the issue… apparently not though.

reviewDescription:
This is a user-beware complaint. I set up a MoneyLion account to check out their services. When I reached out to the company, which was less than a week into opening the account, I was told they could deactivate my account but could not delete it or my information, which makes no sense. I then asked well what additional steps could be taken to complete the deletion of all my data. I was told there was non. I then requested an email to confirm the deletion of the account because they offered no confirmation of this. I was put on hold and was sent an email that is attached. When the representative returned to the line, I asked her, I am currently on the app, and the button in the app clearly stated to delete the account, not deactivate it. Her response was only people residing in California could entirely delete their account, which is a significant miss representation as there is nothing in the app that says that, and the button and prompts are clear to delete, not deactivate.

Beware this company is basically stealing your information and will not fully delete your account which can lead to major leaks of your information to third parties.
reviewTitle: THEY WILL KEEP YOUR INFORMATION AND SELL IT

reviewDescription:
I've run into problems with them several times..
If you ever do use this service Be Aware when drawing down Instacash. It will ask you for a tip, if you say no, it tries again for a second time, and you say no again.. yep you guessed it.. they ask for a THIRD time. Its sneaky the way they do it too.
I asked a customer service rep, what the tip is for and he told me "you wouldn't ask a waiter what his tip is for"🤦‍♂️
BUT WAIT.. THERE'S MORE!!
I paid my loan payment April 30, 2023 before going into the hospital and it crossed paths with an automatic withdrawal for the same payment, which I didn't have enough to cover both. I was told my 04/30/23 payment covered July and the 05/05/23 was late. Whaattt? So I asked for a refund on the "July" payment so the June payment would clear.. they said no, because they already had the money🤔 EXACTLY..THEY HAD THE MONEY🤦
I told them that I would stop payment on the July installment, so the June would clear, which it did.. however it threw my entire profile off with Money Lion and STILL having problems 8 months later. I have an investment account that won't let me withdraw, because of fraud concerns due to the bank return.. yet they continue to take money from me to invest!? I can never get help from customer service, there is Never a supervisor available and they tell me one will call within 24 hours.. hmmmm, STILL WAITING..
It has been 8 months that they have not only held onto my money, but continued to take from me and it's not even invested in anything 😲
BTW.. during this 8 months I have paid off one credit builder loan and acquired another.. so if you can figure that out, please explain it to me.

reviewDescription:
First....these other 5 star reviews read....so much like commercials. Does anyone really love a banking app? Give me a break...
Ive had this account for 3 yrs....never really had any use with it because it always says Im eligible for XYZ and at the last minute says I'm not.
So heres where its shady...I decided to delete it. Served no purpose but they had access to my accounts, so wanted it deleted. The chatbot couldnt do it. Customer service couldnt do it ... and when I found Account Management and selected "delete my account" it said my account wasn't eligible for deletion.
Mind you, there is no negative balance. No loans....just them connected to my real account and holding all my data.
You cant delete your external account from them....so I'll likely go from my actual banks side to just block them.
But ultimately...they seem more about knowing your business than performing the functions you've signed up for ... and thats just dangerous in this age of breaches and ID theft.
I also feel it is unsavory for an App that charges fees and interests for their services .... to constantly request a Tip! Seriously....they want to charge 9 dollars to fund an account 100 for a repayment in 2 weeks .... that's about 25% APR. Fine...but then they have the nerve to ask for a tip?
After asking for that tip ... the app randomly popped up another request for a tip in 60 seconds.
So if you want to bank with a panhandler who is already making money off of you that wont let you leave and constantly is checking your wallet to see if you have cash somewhere else .... then ya .... youll love this service.
But back to their reviews...take note of the way they form the sentences in review after review. English is obviously not the first language and that raises flags. For instance .... we dont say "Prominet Company" in the US we say "Reputable Company" .... a Prominet anything ... is "famous" or "noticeable" .... but not credible, trustworthy or reputable. So many reviews are littered with the wrong adjectives and its just obvious Money Lion is cooking the books on their reviews.

reviewDescription:
I sent a payoff for my credit builder plus loan via cashier's check on June 26, 2023. I have been calling every week for an explanation as to why my loan has not been paid off. I called my bank to place a stop pay on the check the other day but was informed that the check was deposited into their account on July 24,2023. Everytime I speak with a customer care specialist they say it has not arrived to them and they have to escalate the issue to another department to be researched and they will email me. When asked to speak to that department, I was told they could not allow the customer to be in contact with them. I barely receive any correspondence from them regarding the issue. Today I had to demand to speak with a supervisor and the supervisor read the same script until I told him I was going to obtain legal counsel. I am going to sue them for emotional distress, attorney fees, etc because this is ridiculous. Their customer service also sucks because as a customer you have to repeat yourself with every person you speak with even when they do a warm transfer. Everyone reads from the same script and there is no personalized genuine engagement with the customer.

Update: I just received an email stating they did receive the check and are processing my payoff after I left my reviews and informed them that I was seeking legal counsel to resolve this issue. Lol such a coincidence

Update/reply: My issue is not resolved yet because my payoff has not been processed almost 1 month after my check was deposited into their business account. I'm still being charged interest, regular payments, and membership fees. Can anyone say suspicious activity/emotional distress?

reviewDescription:
I recently transitioned my banking to MoneyLion, hoping to leverage their services to enhance my credit score, a challenge for a young entrepreneur with a limited credit history. My decision to switch was further influenced by my husband's positive experiences with their platform. Yet, my journey with MoneyLion has morphed into a harrowing ordeal that now threatens the very survival of my business.

The nightmare began with the freezing of my account following a standard $4,000 deposit from a domestic client, a transaction that should have been routine but has inexplicably put my ability to pay bills and even feed my children at risk.

In my search for answers, I encountered an almost non-existent customer service system. The representatives I spoke with offered nothing but hollow, rehearsed lines devoid of empathy or understanding. Their indifference has been nothing short of terrifying. I've spent the day oscillating between bouts of crying and futile attempts to communicate with MoneyLion's team, culminating in a staggering six hours of calls, chats, and emails, ending in abrupt disconnections and no resolution.

After being informed of the need to verify my identity, I promptly submitted the required documents: a copy of my ID, a recent utility bill, and a photograph of myself holding my identification. Instead of resolving the issue, each submission was met with a new, seemingly arbitrary critique—the photo didn't show my shoulders, the image wasn't zoomable, and my face didn't match because I wasn't wearing my glasses. The scrutiny intensified with conflicting information regarding my business and residential addresses.

Each representative I spoke with seemed to have a different story about what it would take to regain access to my account. Yet the message was always the same: an apology followed by their inability to assist. Requests to speak with supervisors or specialized departments led nowhere.
My diligence in following their every direction has led to nothing but frustration.

I'm left with a business at risk, employees reluctant to work for me, and the looming specter of late fees on unpaid bills. The fear of never regaining access to my funds, a fear fueled by similar stories uncovered during desperate research, is overwhelming. This entire experience has left me feeling ill, on the edge of a breakdown, and without hope. Having my account access revoked after providing all the requested information seems unjust and downright fraudulent.

As I write this, I am distraught, scared, sick with worry, and seething with anger. There was no fraud on my account, only the actions of a company that has now become a roadblock to my financial well-being and peace of mind. I cannot fathom how a company can justify such treatment of a customer. My situation is dire, and I implore anyone who reads this to understand the severity of MoneyLion's actions and their devastating impact on real lives.

*UPDATE - NOW MONEY LION WANTS A PHOTO OF MY SOCIAL SECURITY CARD!!!

I am at my wits' end with Money Lion's relentless invasion of my privacy and their unfounded refusal to grant me access to my own account and funds. It's a harrowing ordeal to watch helplessly as gatekeepers of my financial lifeline demand piece after piece of personal information, with no end in sight. With every new request, it feels less like a security measure and more like an unwarranted interrogation, leaving me to question the safety and privacy of my most sensitive information. Their denial of direct communication with a fraud department, a department that should be at the forefront of resolving such issues only amplifies my distress. It's maddening and deeply concerning that MoneyLion is holding my money hostage, effectively paralyzing my business and personal life. This is not just poor customer service; it's a blatant disregard for customer rights and a breach of the trust I placed in a financial institution that promised to act in my best interest.

MONEYLION'S NEW RESPONSE

reviewDescription:
UPDATE: 5/16
As of today, Money Lion has rectified the issue and deposited the money into the correct account, thank you Money Lion for finally fixing this issue.

UPDATE 5/15-
As of today, credit reserve still not in my account. Spoke with an agent this morning who was no help, can’t get a straight answer other than it’s pending. Same BS, I’ll call you back which they never do, I paid the loan off April 21, and within 14 days per documentation my credit reserve balance of $700 was supposed to be deposited into my RoarMoney bank account. It’s been 3.5 weeks since I paid in full and now I’m told today it’s still in pending status, DoNotDo business with Money Lion, do your research, this has been a painful emotional process to deal with and still no answer, ridiculous. Shame on you Money Lion!!!!

UPDATE 5/12-
As of today, money not deposited, called in and spoke to an agent who told me word for word same BS as previous 3 agents, now I’m told another 5-7 days, this is unacceptable. Something is not right, STAY AWAY from Credit Reserve Loans. I feel like it’s a scam, being lied to on a daily basis, can’t get a straight answer only agents reading a script, each time I’m told your money has been moved to an investment account and funds will be disbursed after process is complete. Reading my loan documents, funds should have been deposited into my account no later than 14 days after loan was paid off, now going past 3 weeks….have no choice but to seek legal help, this is complete misery.

If I could give a zero I would, what started off as a great experience has turned into a nightmare. I paid off a Credit Reserve loan April 21, and was per contract to be paid the $700 reserve into my Money Lion Roar Banking account within 14 days…as of this morning I still have not received it. I have called in numerous times and each time was told different days on when it would be paid. They claimed there was an internal issue and that the payment into my account was rejected and they had to escalate the issue. They make it up each time, this morning im told there was an issue with the algorithm internally which is why it was rejected…Really???? from my research it looks like what I going thru has happened to thousands of people around the US. Extremely disappointed in their customer service, how do these service agents sleep at night knowing they are lying to people on a daily basis? I would not recommend Money Lion to anyone, stay away.

reviewDescription:
If you had asked me yesterday how I felt about MoneyLion I would’ve emphatically told you that I was happy, excited, optimistic about my financial future with them. They have tons of ways to invest, build your credit, apply for various loans, etc. But they also use those same lender finder companies to look for loan options so when you “check your rate” they’re actually sending your info out to dozens of other lender finders and MAYBE an actual lender or two. At this point you can burn whatever email you signed up with because you will be inundated with CONSTANT loan offers that keep coming weeks after you first checked your rate. That’s just a minor annoyance compared to what they did that completely changed my mind about them. I had a large deposit that was being transferred from Bank of America into my RoarMoney checking account and it was taking forever, so I checked in daily with customer service. I spoke to 4 different people. The first 3 told me I just needed to wait til the end of the day and it should be in my account. The money was sitting in a queue where they could see it but I couldn’t see it pending in my account. For 3 days I am reassured that it’s going to be in my account and that it’s just fine. They were aware of the amount, the name of the person sending it, the other banks name, they knew everything. So today, after speaking to someone in customer service about the pending status and hearing “end of day” again I was surprised to see that my checking account wouldn’t refresh when I checked the app a few hours later. I blamed it on my internet, but when it was still happening a while later I called customer service and asked for some clarification about the issue. He checks it out and proceeds to tell me that the account had been closed by MoneyLion due to suspicious activity and I was not eligible to reopen it….wait, what? No phone call to v inquire about the transaction to see if it was me? They won’t even tell me if it actually involved a transaction. I know absolute nothing about the cause of the closure. They told me two things: “that is all that I can tell you about it” and “they reference the agreement you signed when you got the account”. When has your bank ever just shut down your account PERMANENTLY because they flagged an outlier transaction in your account? I had just put that account information on my direct deposit info for the job I’m starting next week. I have invested in Bitcoin, and several stock options, spread my money all throughout the app because u thought that they would do right by me. I was wrong. There was nothing offered but a meek apology from the customer service guy and when I asked to speak to someone in management he just told me that they don’t have the ability to overturn it. Ummmm, sir….the only thing I want overturned at this point is the establishment’s reputation 🙄 on top of everything, they waited 3 days while the money was pending and just rejected it today. There was absolutely no attempt to reach out to me before they axed the account. I’m frustrated and angry and so annoyed because I don’t have time to deal with this unnecessary bs. I’m a single mom if 3 kids working 60+ hours a week just trying to get myself financially fit and if that is your goal too then I suggest you look elsewhere because MoneyLion does shady business. I’m just hoping that ‘rejected’ transfer gets back to the right place. Try out Kikoff for credit repair and Stash for your investment endeavors and don’t give these jokers your money or your trust.
eta: I was told I’d have access to everything but the checking account and I am now locked out of my entire account meaning they’re stealing not just my checking account balance but also all of my investments. What do I do???
reviewTitle: Keep your John Hancock in your pants, once you sign they can do what they want, according to them

reviewDescription:
Paid for credit builder plus and opened a RoarMoney account. Have taken out a loan (with part of it in their "escrow") and have utilized Instacash. Now that they are happily taking my money in monthly installment payments and subscriptions, they decide they can't "verify" my identity so I can't actually access any of the perks I'm paying for. I'm assuming this is due to the fact that they will not let me update my address, because I have to wait 30 days (even though I NEVER updated it - my account had been sitting opened and unused for years). In addition to not being able to access perks I'm PAYING for, like Instacash, I can't even get a debit card sent to me to try to access the Lionshare bonus to cover the cost of my subscription. And, to add insult to injury, the 30 days to update my address keeps moving - I contacted customer service on 2/27 and it was a little over a week into the 30 day period - when I contacted them today 3/8 - they told me it was now 30 days from 3/4. So now something as simple as updating my address becomes an impossible moving target, meanwhile my account is useless while I wait. This all feels like a scam, everything seems great at first and then once they have you, you suddenly don't have full access to your account. I can't wait to pay off the loan ASAP and withdraw my money and close this account. It's not worth the hassle, all because updating an address is apparently a chore.
Run, don't walk, to get away from this company.
reviewTitle: My goodness, just let me change my address.

reviewDescription: I have been using their Roar Banking for months now & it’s been great to use until I actually came across a problem. On November 24 I placed an order for $887 with a merchant for a gift to be delivered to a friend. One month went by & my friend never got the package & their tracking system for package never updated since I placed the order. I opened a dispute on Dec 22nd & found out that the merchant LOST my package. They also took down the order from their site. I sent MoneyLion dispute team photos of my conversation with merchant when they said that they lost my package. Wouldn’t it make sense that I would have my money back easily since merchant lost my package? But no, 2 months have gone by since I opened my dispute & I have gotten nothing from them. No emails or updates about dispute AT ALL.. first they said that I will get a email about provisional credit I waited weeks and never got an email, I called the customer service at the end of January and I was told that I am not eligible for provisional credit, that’s not a problem for me but they never informed me themselves. Then on the phone their agent also said that in February I would get an email possibly asking about more information for their investigation. February is almost to an end and I’ve never gotten an email. Every time I ask support about any updates, they have nothing to say and they always tell me it can take up to 90 days. It’s starting to sound like they are just lazy or not on top of things. And they have no intentions of resolving this sooner than 90 days. Right now, my package was lost and it’s not even on the site anymore and I don’t even have my money. The fact that their investigation for such a simple dispute is taking so long is ridiculous. Just terrible service. I’ve had to dispute things with other banks over the years & even recently due to getting invalid digitally products & those other banks resolve the disputes within a few weeks, it never actually takes months & months. MoneyLion isn’t a bank & they don’t function like one either. I hope no one here has to ever open a dispute with MoneyLion

reviewCompanyResponse: We are beyond thrilled to see that you are utilizing many of the financial services/tools that we offer. Thank you for this incredibly detailed review, we appreciate it immensely!
reviewDescription: This was my first time dealing with this type of bank. That being said I have been a customer for years. This company has said AND done everything their advertising claimed it would do for me within reason. InstaCash, CreditBuilding, Loans, Debt Relief, Investing, Cash Rewards etc. Yes you have to wait quite a bit to speak with a CSR sometimes. Just as with many places nowadays e.g. Social Security, Walmart, my primary care doctor. Still any/all issues I've ever had were resolved in a timely matter. Some tips- Please just stay respectful. They are not fraudulent or thieves. Their transparency is literally sent to you in writing. So make sure you read all of the fine print in the documents they send you so you aren't thrown for a loop if/when they follow through on their word. Lastly the FAQs can pretty much answer, and possibly resolve, 90% of what you call customer service for. I do highly recommend using MoneyLion if for nothing else, credit building, other financial opportunities, and investments.

reviewDescription: I love love loved this app until you have a breach of your account. They are so great in so many aspects until my account was compromised oh Jan 4-5, 2023. I got an email telling me that my phone number was changed in my account and it was associated with another Moneylion account. So I immediately locked my cards and called customer service. I was unaware that a 397.00 transaction was done to Target and a transfer of 200.00 was made from my external account. The lady on phone gave me the fraud team which was going to help me. Not so much. After my dispute was made, I changed my password and felt safe. But after 3 days tjey told me that there was no error and I would not get my money back. I went to work. Found the the Target from which the purchase was made and talked to their security. This target was located in NH and I live in Louisiana. This was an online purchase and they also agreed after checking my online Target account that this was not my purchase. I also had the email from Moneylion telling me someone had got into my account with a 303 area code which in Delaware. I called them at Moneylion. They listened I sent them all the info and they decided me that the would give me a provisional credit. Well they have now came back saying they still found no error. I’m just speechless. 397.00 of my money that I did not use and I’m being penalized because someone breached my account and though my cards got locked they let this happen. I’m so disappointed and furious. I will again have to go thru the trouble to get back money I did not spend. So so much for their support. I do like so many parts of this company until you run into a problem.
reviewTitle: I love love loved this app until you…

reviewDescription: The instacashes were great, problem is the credit builder plus loan, they offer you a minimum loan but don't give you the entire loan and will only give you $200 out of the $1000, and have you keep making payments on that $1000 loan eventhough you didn't get the entire amount. Then they refuse to close your account app request until you pay the full $1000, then they mess up your credit score by stating you owe $1000, when you were only given $200. This company is a joke and a scam it should be reported to BBB, how dare you guys force people to pay amounts that was promised but was never given?

Please paste this link into a browser, fill out the information requested, and we will be in touch! https://mlion.info/customerhelp
reviewDescription: I've been a member for several years. They will change requirements to use their features without telling you. They will also send you emails saying we gave you an instacash boost then there won't be anything available and support says "you have already used the boost a week earlier". So basically the "thank you for being a loyal customer here is a 75 dollar instacash boost" is misleading. Also I've gotten several credit builder loans. The last one I paid off way earlier with the thinking of just getting another one. So I paid 330 remaining on a 500 loan, the app says you are approved for 500 but when you get to the part to accept and sign off it gives an error "it's not you it's the internet" then you contact support and they tell you it is you and you need to have a second checking account added in good standing. Ok so they push using them for direct deposit and your banking but expect you to get a secondary account to access services for which you are paying. Had I known this I would have kept paying the minimum. Instead I over extended myself and paid it off which has now caused me to fall behind on bills. If this was communicated clearly then i could have made a better decision. The requirements are just disclosed to their support.Then instacash they only let you withdraw it in 100 dollar increments so let's say you have an 800 limit each 100 you request they tack on fees then they ask you for a tip. Then if you don't give a tip the next time you use it they have some picture of a condescending looking guy talking about how money doesn't grow on trees... But if you are paying back every two weeks just the fees alone would be a high apr if this was a traditional loan. There have been many other situations that I have had to deal with over the years that I would not have to deal with if I was with a traditional bank.
reviewTitle: I've been a member for several years

But yet the app is stating that based on my information provided I am no longer eligible. Craziest thing ever perfect account performance equals $755 instacash available but yet I am not eligible for an advance.

I have screenshots of my account. I called just to gain some insight of what I have done to no longer be eligible despite the fact that I am in excellent standing.

reviewDescription:
Been a member since 2020. Everything was fine until I had to change banking accounts: I had to close my Navy Federal checking Account due to fraudulent activity, so I transferred my payroll deposit to MoneyLion's RoarMoney account until while Navy Federal reviewed the police report. Once I opened a new Navy Federal checking account and tried to delete the old one and connect the new one, everything went haywire.

First MoneyLion's system told me I was not a Credit Builder Plus member...I AM. I have the Instacash option and I am currently paying off a THIRD Credit Builder loan, two products that REQUIRE a membership. Then MoneyLion tells me it cannot detect my payroll deposits...how so? It's the SAME company that deposited my payroll when I was using my RoarMoney account. NOTHING HAS CHANGED. Next, MoneyLion says it cannot even detect my new checking account at all.....but you are able to see that I've been transferring funds between my savings and the NEW checking account? You can't detect it but you can see its activity?

I previously spoke with someone named Joan, who claimed she deleted the old Navy Federal account and re-connected the new one. She did not; on 12/28, a different customer service specialist had to do it. I am not on my 4th contact with MoneyLion about this issue, and it still has not been resolved. Looks like I will be saying goodbye to ANOTHER company in 2023. A simple checking account update should not be this difficult.

reviewDescription:
UPDATE - MoneyLion did reach out to me and the support was helpful. I still think their requirements for ID verification are excessive but I was able to get my account reopened and my issue was resolved. Just a little sad that it had to be an issue in the first place and that I had to post negative reviews to get their attention. There are many good things about this account and instacash really saved me many times. Just don't put all your eggs in 1 basket.

Had an account for almost a year and they flagged a transaction as unusual activity, froze my account, wasted my time for several days and got me in trouble with 2 credit cards by rejecting the payments I had made before the freeze. They rejected everything I sent in to try to verify my identity, closed my account and sent my direct deposit from my job back to the job making me have to go to my payroll dept and try to get the money they sent back. This has been a total nightmare, never again.

reviewDescription: SCAM- BEWARE!!! This platform will sell your information and you will be contacted by many scammers. I was scammed out of almost $8000 and have no recourse. No customer service. Very difficult to get anyone on the phone and they sound just like the scammers who called me. The scammers are smart and represent actual good companies, only to find out that they have not received any of your information and are not their client. Has created HUGE financial problems when I turned to them to help. It is a never ending cycle. STAY AWARE AND STAY AWAY. They prey on people with less than perfect credit and will ruin whatever credit you have. Total scam and waste of valuable time and money. reviewCompanyResponse: Hi Renee! Thank you so much for taking the time to write this review. We hear you and sincerely apologize for any stress or inconvenience these instances have caused. We created Instacash to help you access extra money to cover everyday essentials and unexpected expenses. For these reasons, we only allow you to take out Instacash advances in increments of $100 or less. Keep in mind, tipping is always optional! Just be sure to read the screens and make your selections carefully. You are able to use Instacash without tips or fees! One of our Customer Advocates will be reaching out shortly to help answer any additional questions you may have. Again, thank you for taking the time to provide feedback and for being a part of MoneyLion!
reviewDescription:
They claim your eligible for more than $100, however; you can only accept up to $100 at a time. I believe it's deceiving because all fees attached to EVERY advance we initiate become incorporated in whatever amount they claim we are eligible for. Each time and advance is taken, they asses the same amount of fees ($8.99) no matter if the advance is $1 or $100. Not to mention that in order to have instant access to any advance, it's an additional $3.99. Otherwise, the money will transfer to your bank account just as any banking transfer does, within 3-4 business days FEE FREE besides the $8.99.
I could be wrong here but according to my experience and knowledge, the vast majority of instances where someone chooses to obtain an advance of any amount does so only because they NEED TO. Obviously, whatever circumstances they find themselves in- it's evident they need $ right away AND don't have any/enough. No one of sound mind and judgement would willfully choose to borrow money and pay 8.99 otherwise. Clearly, the money they choose to borrow is needed right then, not 3-5 days later. Therefore, It's highly probable that they have to pay the constant amount of 8.99 PLUS an additional $3.99 for same day access to said advance (maybe more than once if more than $100 is needed.) They claim we can get an advance "fee free," which only technically is PARTIALLY accurate because the only fee that theoretically doesn't have to be assessed is in the super rare case that a person can wait until whenever the normal bank transfer completes. EVERYONE IS ALWAYS PAYING $8.99 PER ADVANCE, PERIOD. Their BS claim of "fee free" is exactly that.
No ability to custom tip either. You choose their pre set tip amounts based on advance amount or you tip NOTHING. There's no other option.

IMPORTANT! Please read: This app claims to provide you with up-to-date accurate personal credit information.
I DONT KNOW WHOSE CREDIT INFORMATION THEY HAVE AND CLAIM IT'S MINE, BUT EVERY MANUFACTURED BIT OF INFO IS NOT MINE, HAS NEVER BEEN MINE, WILL NEVER BE MINE.
I've never owned any assets they claim I do. Every single figure they insist is associated with me is so STRAIGHT UP Impossible I can't believe it.
Upon speaking with a representative, they had the audacity to insist that they obtained all the information from my bank. They insisted the information was up to date and accurate. Completely refusing to believe me when I explained that this is absolutely 100% NOT MY INFORMATION.
CRAZY.

Be certain they didn't go rogue with your credit information and that every single thing that they have documented is actually your own!
Make sure that you go into the app and check your credit summary and make sure that they are using your information because I'm sure I'm not the only person with someone else's credit information.

reviewCompanyResponse: Chloe, we are so sorry to hear about this experience with your direct deposit. Although we offer early direct deposit, the exact timing of when you will receive your funds depends on the payroll provider and the bank transfer process. reviewDescription: I used to like Moneylion and the products it offers but I’m am ending my relationship with this company due to false advertising and useless customer support. Moneylion use early direct deposit as a way to lure customers, but don’t rely on it. It was great for a while until it didn’t come one day, and I received 10 different answers about why and was told to just keep checking my account. The day of my actual payday, when anyone would expect funds to arrive overnight or at least the morning, I never received the deposit. I called Moneylion and was told to “be patient” and that the funds would arrive within the day. That never happened. In the evening I contacted customer support again, and then was told that it could arrive on in the evening, but it could be the weekend, and to call back if I didn’t see it on Saturday. My interpretation of their response “yes, we received the funds from your employer, but we are holding it for no reason and we cannot tell you why or when you will receive it, sorry!” Their customer support representatives are no help and honestly a waste of your time. Their complaint form is also a waste of time; I never received a response. If you need an alternative financial institution to traditional banks, look elsewhere. 0 compassion or understanding of who their target customers are or and their needs. Their customer support responds quickly but what does that matter if no one can offer real answers or actual support.
reviewTitle: Do not trust this company with your money

reviewDescription: Completely dissatisfied and beyond upset with all of my recent interactions with customer service and it’s features. Switched my direct deposit and all my financial activity to MoneyLion yet not eligible for credit builder plus, agents have no capability with anything besides stating to wait patiently for any concerns regarding my funds, agents do not communicate promptly through sms or email, I have received a $335 cash advance plus another $335 advance that totaled about $650 with fees and was paid on time when it was due. Now I am only eligible for half that amount, on payday. There goes all my hard earned money for repayment but not eligible for a similar amount as the previous advance. If I’m in good standing with an institution and never ever late with repayment along with direct deposit linked, how am I not eligible for a much more reasonable amount? I can go all night with how I’ve been unsatisfied and extremely upset with this institution. When my hold of $120 clears a month from now(unfortunately, that’s how long MoneyLion is taking to process such transaction, I will be considering closing my account and returning to my previous institution. At least there the agents are more helpful and punctual. All my crypto assets I had planned to move over to money lion along with my investments will be canceled immediately. I’ve never been so frustrated and unsatisfied with an institution that handles money and cryptocurrencies as I am now. Most problems do not get resolved and I’m tired being left unsure or confused at an institution that has my hard earned money being direct deposited into. I have a lot of thinking to do but if closing this account is what I have to do then I will proceed with it.

reviewCompanyResponse: Hi Lisa! Initially, as a bonus, you will get more Instacash than what you are eligible for, in order to make your experience better. However, this bonus is not permanent, and we are glad you are enjoying our service. But as of right now, we would be happy to make sure that you are receiving the correct amount that you are supposed to be eligible for. Please fill out this form: https://mlion.info/3wDGxLS
reviewDescription: I have been using instacash for 6 months or so. My limit was $165 to 185. I always paid it back early. Also I make A DAILY DIRECT DEPOSIT OF $100 OR MORE! Suddenly my instacash amount is $115! I call cust svc and speak with Angel. She tells me that its been reduced because a few repayments "failed". I told her that was a mistake. After asking her to look my account records she said she sees that I deposit daily and ALL MY PAYMENTS HAVE BEEN ON TIME OR EARLY! She still can't tell me why my instacash was reduced. After demanding to speak to a supervisor and being on hold for 40 minutes, a supervisor named Jack gets on the phone. I let him know I love the instacash feature and have raved to my friends and family about MoneyLion. In fact at least 7 friends have become MoneyLion customers. After reviewing my account in a nutshell he tells me my limit was lowered because the higher limit was to "entice" me as a new customer and even though I DIRECT DEPOSIT OVER $100 EVERY DAY THE LIMIT WAS REDUCED TO $115 BECAUSE OF THEIR ALGORITHM! I told him that is not stated anywhere. He said that the enticement method is told to the customer at MoneyLion's discretion. If I want a higher limit. I should make my direct deposits once a week or every other week. THAT MAKES NO SENSE!!!! MY DAILY DEPOSITS HAVE BEEN FINE TO GET THE HIGHER AMOUNT FOR THE LAST 6 MONTHS! I let Jack know I was unhappy with this and it is not right that the company "entices" (his word, not mine) and then suddenly drops your borrowing power without disclosing this info upfront. I asked him how would he feel if he was the customer? With that he ended the call and hung up on me!

Customer representative looked into the request and couldn’t find any transaction on their end, but couldn’t come to a resolution to refund the missing advance. I ended up paying for the advance since I had auto pay setup. After multiple emails and phone calls I gave up and moved on.

reviewDescription: Unfortunately I can't give a good review. I was a moneylion user, and one in good standing at that.i always paid back on time and worked my advance total up. But then the app asked me to ID verify. I had no problem with this. I took the photo of my id. The app wouldn't accept the photo. I tried uploading five times to get the same result. After the money lion app wouldn't accept my id they disqualified me. I have spoken to first level customer service and they say there's nothing they can do. I asked for contact by a supervisor who can give me an explanation of the problem. They wouldn't do that either. I asked to close my account and to take my information out of their system since I can't use it. They won't do that either. So basically I have a useless app on my phone that I can't get rid of or use. No communication to understand the problem and possibly resolve it. All they left me with is a struggle. That money helped my family in between checks and it hurt us when it dried up for no reason. Frankly I'm angry about it and I want a resolution. Either the account closed and deleted or the problem fixed. Certainly since I am not the cause of the problem in the first place.
reviewTitle: Unfortunately I can't give a good…

Today August 17 2022 I woke up to my money being refunded but then I was hacked by $CohesiveKeagan219. I again called Moneylion only to be told they had to investigate this first and it could take up to 30 days. I was left with .85 to my name. Not even 5 mins later I was down to -.48. I do not recommend Moneylion to anyone!! Their customer service is overall horrible and you are left with no money in your account!

reviewDescription: I have had my Money Lion accounts for over 3 years now. I've never had any issues that couldn't be solved without a quick online chat with a representative. I have a checking and an investment/savings account. The only fees I have ever had to pay is the $1.00 a month maintenance fee for the handling of my stocks and bonds. They do everything for you. The ATM fees will eat you up if you don't use the recommended ones and it's kindof tricky to fund your account without a consistent direct deposit. I would also advise to keep your account open with your regular 'brick and mortar" bank because they want you to link your outside account with them in order to do certain tasks that are necessary. The best part is the "Insta-cash" loans that you are offered with no interest. You can receive up to $250 in your account, instantly, at any time. I really do Love this Bank!
reviewTitle: I really do Love this Bank!

reviewDescription: Been with Moneylion going on two years now, and for the most part was satisfied with their staff and services. Well that is until July 2022. There was an issue with my instacash eligibility amount. Somehow it had gotten switched to my Roar Money account instead of using my external account. Well the income difference substantial. I contacted a customer care agent and was told that he switched it back to my external account and that the insta cash eligibility amount would be corrected back to its normal amount within two business days that was July 6th well here it is August 3rd and it still has not been corrected I get a different story from every customer care agent. I was told this was escalated to their dedicated team whoever that may be more than a dozen times. I have over 24 hours of real time invested in explaining this problem and why there's a difference in the amount and the math that they keep trying to use on me. I've received 20% of my income on external account for over a year. Because of the perks of several of the different products that I use with them. At this point I give up this thing is nearly costing me my apartment as I was given this information so when moving I failed to make other arrangements to pay a electric deposit. Because I figured that the person on the line working for my financial institution knew what he was talking about. but this happened more more than one occasion with more than one agent as I said before I went through this with several different customer care agents and they were all on different page giving me different time frames and different hope to know about. I apologize for the long windedness of this review but as apparently speaking directly to a customer care agents and having an issue accelerated or escalated or prioritized whatever fails to do anything apparently. Except receive emails where they try to break down the math of why my amount is what it is based off the wrong account which was the issue in the first place. Why am I receiving which quite frankly is ignorant emails saying that basically the problem is the solution? Was thinking about moving all of my income into my Roar money account but if they cannot coordinate any better than what I have seen this month I'm a little worried about doing so. I hope this is rectified and they come back to the standard that I received for the first year and a half of doing business with them. This past month has been nothing but what I have felt like are lies and blow off tactics.
reviewTitle: Customer care agents word mean nothing? And why aren't they all on the same page?

reviewDescription: I always know what to expect with my Roar Money account and Moneylion. My deposit always posts exactly when it should so I'm never left in doubt about the ability to pay my bills on time. When the unexpected happens, it is nice to have the flexibility of Instacash. And let's not forget one of the key features of having a Roar Money account, Credit Builder Plus. It really helped to improve my credit score. If it can improve mine, no one is exempt from the benefits of having a Moneylion account that ties all of these features together. I would highly recommend to all of my friends and family!

reviewDescription:
I recently started using this application maybe a month or two so far and I plan to discontinue after my next pay off. I called and inquired on my 250 once I received notifications about being eligible when talking with a representative barely speaking good English he was very smug and proceeded to tell me they were providing more than enough, which realistically is a lie I get paid weekly and would have been qualified for 250 very dissatisfied with his response very bad customer service at the end of the day this isn’t the only application willing to give people money , let alone don’t act like y’all are doing folks a favor that’s what my bank is for if I ever needed a huge favor, I don’t recommend this app.
Update 08/10/2022
Upon placing my complaint on Trust Pilot the company has retaliated by unlinking my account taking the payout down to 25 when I had been approved for 175 when reaching out to a rep I informed them of an email I received about linking an account I also provided receipts that my account was already linked as I used their app a few times already with no issues up until I raised concerns , the company is discriminatory and will retaliate when they are in the wrong I do not recommend this app try other apps such as Dave. I have enough receipts to report their behavior to the bbb !
08/16/2022
By far the crappiest company I’ve dealt with they went in an authorized a charge with out my consent to my bank I called and they would not refund the transaction as my bank had me call them back to see if they would reverse the pending charge as it has not posted they have caused me to be charged a fee with my bank due to their incompetence I was not made aware or provided a notice that they would take money from an account that had zero in it we all knows what happens there okay, they wouldn’t know that because of their lack of communication, I talked with two managers and was under the impression I would be refunded and the entire amount would come out on the 26th with the first guy & that wasn’t the case when I called back the second time , this company is a complete rip off that preys on minorities that speak out against their unjust and discriminatory actions then proceeded to show me a document that doesn’t explain anything about the amount they would take, & the time frame they would auto debit an account if it was not payed on time I plan to file a lawsuit against their actions. Avoid this app by any means necessary I wouldn’t wish my experience on an enemy , payday loans any sort of loan would be better than money lion they charge you tips and transfer fees if you opt to not leave a tip they will add whatever amount they want into what you owe, while making sure you do more than one withdrawals to redeem your full amount as you can only do increments of 100. Waste more money trying to borrow and pay back then a standard payday or bank loan, I hope they are shut down in the future and can not cause financial harm to anyone else.

reviewDescription: I love money lion. I've got the referral bonuses, I love roundup, and getting money is simple. The only thing I don't like is the increments of money in which you can withdraw at a time. This is where they get their money and why I never leave a tip. The 7.99 fee per $100 increment adds up. You can send to your bank fee free, but that takes at least 2/3 business days. You should be able to withdraw the amount of your loan. If this were the case, I'd be more likely to leave a larger amount of a tip. But, all in all. I do love Moneylion.

reviewDescription:
I get my direct deposit sent to Moneylion every pay cycle. I used their instacash feature and have never had a late payment. I recently got a credit builder loan, and this pay cycle, I paid my instacash loan off early. The app said I was again eligible for instacash, but when requested I got an error. When I asked the support chat why, it told me it was due to a “late credit builder loan payment” which is not due for another 2.5 weeks.
I called their support line, who told me that even though the chat provided me an explanation in writing, the reasoning as well as the app stating that I am eligible for $355 in instacash — was not only incorrect, but they could not provide me with a reason that I was no longer eligible at all.

I also had 13 fraudulent charges made on my Moneylion virtual card. So not only did an entire paycheck get taken in less than 24 hours due to fraud charges, but the ability to access instacash to have any money to use was also revoked, with support giving me ZERO information, and zero help.

Do not use this app. It may seem great, I thought it was too for a while. But being a loyal and on time paying customer gets you absolutely nothing and support does not care about you or your money at all!
Not only am I out an entire paycheck, but I also have zero support or even answers from the company that is supposed to be guarding my money.
Stay away from these guys.
reviewTitle: DO NOT USE THIS APP, poor security, predatory and unhelpful! they do not care about you or your money.

reviewDescription: I have had an account with MoneyLion for a year or so. At first I changed my direct deposit to MoneyLion so I could use their Instacash. What they don't tell you is that Instacash takes as long as three months to receive. I kept the account opened and changed my direct deposit back to my original bank. I then stopped using the account. Approximately six months ago I attempted to link my bank account to MoneyLion and it worked. I was authorized a decent amount. I decided I would send my Social Security retirement to my MoneyLion account for one reason only. They advertise that government payments are received as much as four days early. I am familiar with this type of early direct deposit because my current bank also does that with my Veterans Benefits. They state as soon as they receive notification from the US Treasury Department funds are disbursed. I did research and read everything I could to ensure this would apply to my SSA payment. I should have received early direct deposit today from my MoneyLion account. Nothing!! I then contacted them and was told they had received notification and they would disburse the funds Monday. The representative stated specifically, two days early. I informed her what their advertising stated in regards to government payments and at that time was informed that could take three months to adjust. I feel they misrepresented the timeline completely. I was counting on those funds. It has put me in a dire situation. This is basically a large company attempting to portray themselves as helping. When in reality they ask for tips as much or more than payday loan companies require. As soon as my deposit hits I am closing that account and refuse to deal with blatant deception.

reviewDescription:
EDIT: Last response from Customer Advocacy

"As we've investigated your case thoroughly with our dedicated departments, we continue to stand behind our previous decision and respectfully decline your request to process a refund to you." Read that and then read the issue below...


GOOGLE MONEYLION ARBITRATRATION LOSSES. .
Had to pay $70 in fees to my Water company because even though my transaction history, and my bank statement, both showed the funds were there, their system does NOT match what you see. DO NOT USE THIS FOR BANKING. Your account balance is never truly correct, and they stand behind that. I have email confirmation they do this, and stand firm. GO WITH A LOCAL BANK. This is an organization okay with transaction reordering, misrepresentation of balances, and deferring customer service.

Knowing I had enough money accessible on my card I offered to pay for dinner. I was unaware the card automatically accounts for a 20% tip not unlike a gift card. I had planned to tip more remaining within my card balance and was distraught when my card declined. Fortunately I had cash. Embarrassing and lesson learned.
This however is a helpful tool when you run short on cash and need a quick boost in funds. Money is available instantly and at a reasonable fee,I still wish the cash amounts were adjustable not in set increments. I have had to reach out to customer service and they are nice real people that address your concerns quickly and completely.
Overall I recommend Money Lion 100%

Today I called to confirm everything was set up and was given additional information stating that I actually won't receive my funds until July 7th
This is fraud. They are stating that my $22 weekly payment is ach and will take business days and then 2 more business days to release my funds.
The funds are already out of my account
I need communication from someone who can help me and speaks English
I will not have rent due to this I can't do that and I will not be played with next im going to my bank to report it as fraud you choose.

reviewCompanyResponse:
Credit Builder Plus is a powerful membership that includes a credit builder loan and more. For $19.99/month, you get:

Loan up to $1,000 at a competitive rate
Monthly reporting to all credit bureaus and weekly credit score updates
0% APR Instacash cash advances up to $50 per pay period
Lion’s Share Loyalty reward payouts of up to $19.99/month

It’s perfect for those who have no credit or need to rebuild credit. There’s no credit check! You simply link your checking account in the MoneyLion app or dashboard, and we’ll review it for financial and other factors. If you qualify, you’ll get a personalized loan offer up to $1,000. The offer will show you how much of your loan funds you’ll get right away and how much will be saved in a Credit Reserve Account and given to you when you’ve paid your loan in full. This is to help you save while you build credit!

We appreciate your feedback, and if you have any other questions about our Credit Builder Plus membership, please feel free to contact us.

reviewCompanyResponse: Hi Mike, tipping is optional, and whether you choose to tip doesn’t affect your eligibility in any way. Just be sure to read the screens and make your selections carefully, and you can use Instacash without tips or fees if you decide. That said, if you decide to leave a tip, thank you! It helps us cover the costs of providing 0% APR cash Instacash advances to many, many folks like you! We appreciate your feedback, and if you have any other questions, please feel free to contact us directly at 801-252-4427.
reviewDescription:
They will definitely loan you money, and you will build up a payment history with them.

My bank never seems to be able to connect though. When it’s time to pay, they take it out. It’s pretty simple and easy to use.

I don’t like that they kinda guilt trip you into giving them a $10+ tip when borrowing. Of course, it’s lower depending on what you borrow, but it’s still a lot for someone borrowing money due to financial troubles.

The instant transfer fee is $5.99 and they ask that you tip because it’s interest free. If I borrow $100, tip the recommended $10, and pay the same company $5.99 for an instant tranfer(if I’m borrowing from you, it’s most likely because I need the money asap) , I’m paying 16% interest. You will be asked for the tip before the transaction and again when you try to borrow more money.

I do enjoy this app and the money is there when you need it. I’m sure there a bunch of answers to my complaints, but in the end they will loan you the money(extremely dependable if your payment history is good), charge you $2.50 more for a transfer than at an atm, and then send you a sad picture of a worker who didn’t get their tip, twice.
reviewTitle: Good, but will guilt trip you into tipping beyond insane transfer fee

The Best Ever

reviewDescription: What a rip-off scam. They make it sound like the Instant Cash is something you will get immediately. That is not true. It will go into your Roar money wallet instantly, but there's nothing you can do with it from there. I needed money immediately for an emergency medical issue. I thought that the Instant Cash would be instantaneously like they say. You have to pay a fee to get it instantly. I paid 799 the first time. I paid 599 the second time. I don't remember what I paid the third time. The reason I kept requesting additional money, is because for three days I was on the phone, or is it a chat with customer service or a bot.. customer service repeatedly told me that I could get the cash instantly if I went through a third-party app such as PayPal, cash out, or venmo. Moneylion would not linked to any of those and it would not send cash to those apps. They had me spend extra money to get it super fast just so that I would never receive it. I still haven't received it. It takes 3 to 5 days to get into my bank, and that's the only place it will allow me to transfer the money to. I have to pay all these extra fees on top of the amount that they won't cancel. I asked them to cancel all transactions Since I no longer need their money oh, and they say that's impossible. I don't think it's impossible, but nevertheless they won't do it. Nobody knows where the money is that I paid to have immediately. The virtual debit card doesn't work for anything. I don't know why they have it. They say online that you can go to a Allpoint ATM and use it to withdraw cash. That is not true. There is no way that you can do it. I downloaded all these third-party apps, in an effort to link them to moneylion, and moneylion would not linked to them. It did linked to PayPal but it wouldn't send money to PayPal. It wouldn't send money to my debit card because the error message said there was a security problem. It was absolutely no way to get cash immediately and I feel that very deceiving did they write that and their description online over and over again. They also say no fees. Yes there is a fee to get instant cash that you can't get your hands on. The contact list ATMs that they have so many of don't work with the moneylion virtual card. That virtual card is useless. I think it's atrocious that they gave me the wrong information repeatedly and I have to pay for wrong information. It's a rip-off. Don't do it. Don't download the app. I asked them to cancel these transactions that still have not made it to my bank and they won't. I asked them to take back their money that is in their money lion wallet and they won't. They just want me to pay the extra fees. Plus transfer fees. I'm so sorry I ever got involved with this app
reviewTitle: I'm having to pay for their lies to me

reviewDescription: This is the absolute worst company I have ever had the displeasure of opening an account with. To even call it a bank account is bad on my part. I recently opened a money lion card as my options for brick and mortar banks at the moment are limited for reasons I don’t care to get into. That being said I solely rely on money lion for my banking and everyday purchases such as paying bills, buying my daughter food clothing the daily essentials etc etc. Since opening the account for the better half of about 2 weeks, I’ve had over 3 thousand dollars deposited into my money lion account via cash out from PayPal. Never once had an issue. Made purchases daily and even made major purchases with the account including my rent which is around 1400 dollars give or take. Again never having issues with any of that stuff that is until early yesterday afternoon where I received an email stating my account had been locked due to fraudulent activity. Never was a fraudulent charge on my account and if that was the case, I would have most certainly contacted money lion or meta bank on that matter. To cut to the chase, I basically got that issue resolved after hours of aggravating phone calls to foreign representatives who clearly show no sympathy or understanding of how hindering these situations can be. This morning I was unfortunately met with the same issue as the day before except this time my account was apparently closed with 508 dollars still on my account. Tried numerous times to call money lion and nobody is any help. Surprise surprise right? Anyway, upon calling multiple numbers trying to get a hold of someone who could explain to me at the very least on what’s going on I was met with generic pre scripted answers that had little to nothing to do with my specific situation. I did nothing other than use my money lion card and account for your everyday needs, even read the terms of service to make sure I didn’t step out if line and after reading it 3 times over I knew I had done nothing wrong and it was money lion scamming me for 508 dollars. It’s beyond me how a company closes your account and doesn’t let you withdraw funds. Literally the only source of money I had was on here and now I’m in a frenzy trying to situate a mess I didn’t create. If anyone out there has a resolution to this please let me know because I feel so helpless at the moment. I’m looking into hiring an attorney just because I don’t see anywhere else to turn.
reviewTitle: This is the absolute worst company I…

reviewCompanyResponse: Hey Martha! Awesome service, for awesome customers! That is our motto. Thank you for the 5-stars, and for your kind words. Keep spreading the love!
reviewDescription: Awesome service

reviewCompanyResponse: Hi James, We are sorry you are not satisfied with our response, but unfortunately, there are times when we are required to close an account to meet federal regulations. We recommend you work with the originator to recoup the funds.
reviewDescription:
DO NOT TRUST!!! It was good until I disputed $1600 that was fraudulently taken through debit card transactions. I was never alerted, despite having alerts active. Money lion closed my account and locked me out. Said that I violated their agreement. I asked how?? They can't tell me. I asked for my remaining balance but was told that they would "ATTEMPT" return to originator. I supplied the information of the original account in my name but they said they won't return it, it will sit in escheatment for 3 to 5 years... Here are some off my emails as facts:
Hello James,

This is ***reaching out to you with MoneyLion's Customer Advocacy Team in regards to your received complaint. We thank you for allowing us the opportunity to resolve your concerns!

Your account was escalated to me and I was advised that you were looking to reopen your RoarMoney account. As a summary of our findings, effective 4/04/2022, the RoarMoney account has been closed due to violations of our membership agreement.

After reviewing your concerns, MoneyLion respectfully declines your request to reopen the account in question. We truly apologize for the inconvenience and frustration that this may cause. We will attempt to return to the originator or it will go into escheatment depending on the state which can take 3-5 years.

As this is our final determination, please feel free to reach back out to me with any questions you have on your account or the resolution provided and I'd be happy to reopen your case to help out how I can!

Best Regards,
***
MoneyLion Customer Advocate

Dear ***.
Thank you for your email. The originator of the funds is cash app. I have all documentation from them that I will be sending you. You already have the information in your system.
I have already attempted to have MY Funds returned to cash app. However, I am locked out of the money lion account. Kindly return MY money to the originator. Here is the information
In response from cash app:
Since we’re unable to reverse this payment, we need the bank’s help in locating these funds for you. Please provide the following to your bank’s branch manager or debit operations team.

Deposit Amount: note: (I had to remove personal info on this review)

Bank Name: METABANK, NATIONAL ASSOCIATIO
Your time is appreciated.
P.s,
Thankfully, I did not want to reopen my money lion account. I just want my money back.ASAP
Hello James,

I am checking on this to see if the funds can be returned back to Cash App. If they cannot, it will go into escheatment depending on the state which can take 3-5 years. Once I receive an update, I will be following up with you.

In the meantime, if you have any questions regarding your complaint, you may respond to this email and I would be more than happy to assist.


Best Regards,
****
MoneyLion Customer Advocate

MoneyLion Customer Care
Hello James,

Unfortunately, we are unable to return the funds to Cash App. I do apologize for the inconvenience this has caused you. It does appear it will go into escheatment depending on the state which can take 3-5 years.

Your account had been closed in accordance with our membership agreement. Unfortunately, that is all the information we have at this time. If you have further questions, you may refer back to your membership agreement.


Best Regards,
*****
MoneyLion Customer Advocate

MoneyLion Customer care is a joke. They can't help and have pre arranged answers. God forbid if I was relying on my money they have to live and survive on.... BEWARE of the LION.,... Don't trust these people. Ranks of pure SCAM with their unethical practices.
I asked one question from money lion. Why can't you return my money???? I did not abandon my account per laws of escheatment. Why can't they answer my question?? They have my bank information. They know who the originator is. Yet, they ask that I remove personal information from this review. I don't have anything to hide. They do....no transparency. No answers...I'm not someone who judges but what they do is wrong. A legitimate banking institution will not deliberately try to keep your money from you. Do not put your money in money lion unless you can afford to lose it. My experience is real and not biased. I actually liked money lion until they screwed me over and now I know they can't be trusted. I have yet been able to speak with someone from money lion who can answer my questions.
Banks are supposed to be trusted with our money. BEWARE of the roaring lion, they will devour your assets...
