reviewDescription:
The problem is that was $20 fees every month. There’s no way to account for the way you get the money back. I spent the $10 every day for over 20 days And I didn’t get my entire $20 back. Also customer service is nonexistent and I mean nonexistent. Good luck getting somebody on the phone

Yeah the loan is nice but I’d rather get a loan at a higher rate somewhere else and be able to communicate with somebody. I won’t keep any money with them

A little money that you get back on transactions is a nice touch though. But you can do that with Stash as well and get actual stock back

Not for everybody. They serve their purpose even if it is incredibly annoying to deal with them


EDIT: I paid my loan off a couple of weeks ago and I STILL got charged a membership fee LOL

reviewCompanyResponse: Hi Jason, we are sorry to hear you were not satisfied with the result of your dispute. We would like to reach out to you to provide the next steps in the process. We want to assure you that our RoarMoney demand deposit account, provided by Metabank, is a National Association, Member of the FDIC. Please use the link below, and we will reach out to you directly to assist you with your concerns: https://bit.ly/3weo6O6​
reviewDescription:
There were fraudulent transactions during the thanksgiving weekend on my account. The card was with me all the time and I was in the hospital taking care of a family member battelling covid who passed away that weekend.
Long story short, the bank is not NCUA or FDIC Insured. They have no money to give you even if it is not your fault. My entire pay check is gone.
The bank refused to assist initially, requested for paper copies, said blah blah blah we are a paper free company.
Finally in the mail after 3 months, they say after their investigation they found that those transactions were not fraudulent.
Lol, I am closing my account and will stick with other banks that are at least insured.

reviewCompanyResponse: Hello,Tipping is optional, and whether or not you choose to tip doesn’t affect your eligibility in any way. Just be sure to read the screens and make your selections carefully, and you can use Instacash without tips or fees if you decide. That said, if you decide to leave a tip, thank you! It helps us cover the costs of providing 0% APR cash Instacash advances to many, many folks like you!
reviewDescription:
Everything about the app is great except the little loans they offer. You can get up to like $300 which is amazing. However, they get you by asking you to “tip” and then you can only get money in $100 or less increments and they make you pay $4.99 transfer fee for instant transfer which, let’s be real here, if you need a loan of $300 you immediately need it. Not in 3-5 business days. So if you need $300 you have to do 3 transactions which means, 3 tips and 3 transfer fees. I feel like this is very predatory of them to do.

ETA after they replied I went and looked. It’s not 3-5 business days. My bad, it’s 2-5 business days. I also went to test the whole “don’t have to tip” statement with a $5 loan and while it is true, after you say “no tip” a screen pops up that says “are you sure? It’s how we stay interest free. We recommend a $3 tip” so they guilt you into “tipping” them.

Also Moneylion is not accepted on most money apps and it's honestly kind of frustrating. Moneylion use to be my only banking app but I can never find Moneylion on Plaid so I've had to open another bank account with someone else. I feel like Moneylion should be more mainstream by now.

reviewDescription:
Listen, I tried, and failed, other online banking schemes. Who is not one of those, I ask you? MoneyLion... they are for the underprivileged, the 99% of us who work our tails off and get swindled by the pretentious and uppity bank cats in corporate suits, all the while, we bail out their "mistakes" with the coffers our tax portions constantly fill every year, without fail. Predictably, they keep asking for more. MoneyLion, to me, is a real human-being, sympathetic to our plight, with generous pockets, and has a plethora of information on savings, raising credit scores (with action, not just words). They have 1-on-1 consultations about the pitfalls of spending beyond our means and reducing the clutter in the lingo that the elitist use to keep us scratching our heads. I say this: MoneyLion WAS there when my hometown bank of nearly 23 years of banking wouldn't even consider me for a fast cash advance. That hit me the hardest, so I hit back by withdrawing my funds and investing in MoneyLion. You will not regret the service, the simplicity, and the sound of money in your wallets.
What does that sound..sound like?
CHA CHING !!!
and
AAAAAHHH!!!

reviewCompanyResponse: Hello,Instacash funding is FREE if you decide on standard ACH delivery, which takes only 24-48 hours. If you need your Instacash extra fast, you can decide on instant Turbo funding, please visit our website [__https://www.moneylion.com/instacash/__](https://www.moneylion.com/instacash/) to view the turbo fees associated with the amounts and funding method you select. It can take up to four hours to receive. The Turbo fee is totally optional and just helps us cover the cost of delivering your cash advance instantly when you’re in a pinch. We created Instacash to help you access extra money to cover everyday essentials and unexpected expenses, and we designed it easy to repay. For these reasons, we allow you to take out Instacash advances in increments of $100 or less. Of course, if you’ve unlocked an Instacash limit higher than $100, it will all still be available to you if you need it. You’ll just have to take it out in an advance of up to $100 at a time. We appreciate your feedback, and if you have any other questions, please feel free to contact us directly.
